turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He should have armed himself if he was gonna decorate his saloon with the body of my friend.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: I guess you are Three-Fingered Jack out of Missouri, killer of women and children.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I have done that... killed women and children... I have killed most everything that walks or crawls an' now I have come to kill you, Little Bill, for what you done to Ned.  Now step aside. boys.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: I don't... deserve this... to die this way. I was... building a house.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: "Deserve" don't mean shit, Little Bill.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: I'll see you... in hell, you three fingered asshole.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: You work for the railroads too, Mister Beauchamp?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: N-no. I wr-wr-wr-write... I wr- wrwrite...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Letters?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: It's only a b-b-b-book...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: A book, huh?  I guess that means you can read... An' I guess you boys seen them signs about surrendering your firearms... But then, like you told old Andy there, you ain't armed, are you, Bob?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: The... Duck of Death.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: D-d-d-duke. The D-d-duke of Death.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: That is you there, ain't it, Bob? The Duck of Death?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Uh... Duke.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Uh... It's... uh... generally considered desirable in the publishing business to... ah... take certain license in depicting the cover scene... for... ah... purposes involving the... ah, market place.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Well, Mister Beauchamp... from what I read of this here book, I'd have to say the writin' ain't a whole lot different from the pitcher.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Uh... I can assure you, Mister Daggett... the events described within are based... on the accounts of eye witnesses and...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Meaning the duck himself, I guess.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Duke.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Duck, I says.  "You have insulted the honor of this beautiful woman, Corcoran," said the duck. "You must apologize." But Two Gun Corcoran would have none of it and, cursing, he reached for his pistols and would have killed them but The Duck was faster and hot lead blazed from his smoking sixguns."

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: I believe that to be an accurate description of the events, sir... albeit there is a certain poetry to the language which...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Well, Mister Beauchamp, I was at the Blue Bottle Saloon in Wichita the night English Bob killed Corky Corcoran... an' I didn't see you there... nor no woman, nor no twogun shooters nor nothin' like that.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: You were there?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: First off... Corky didn't carry two pistols, though he should of.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: But he was called...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Some folks did call Old Corky "Two Gun" but not because he was sportin' two pistols but because he had a dick so big it was longer than the barrel on that Walker Colt he carried. An' the only insultin' he done was stickin' that big dick of his in some French Lady that Old Bob was sweet on... Well, one day Corky walked into the Blue Bottle and before he knows what's happening Bob takes a shot at him... and misses on account of he's drunker than hell.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Well, that bullet whizzin' by panicked Corky, an' he done the wrong thing! Pulled his gun in such a damn hurry he shot off his own toe. Meantime, Bob aims good and squeezes off another... but he's so drunk he misses again an' hits the thousand dollar mirror behind the bar. Well, now the Duck of Death is good as dead 'cause this time Corky does right an' aims real good, no hurry...

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Bam! That Walker Colt blew up in his hand... which was a failing common to that model. Now if Corky would have really had two guns instead of just a big dick he could have defended himself to the end.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: You... you mean...  English Bob killed him while...?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Well he wasn't gonna wait for Corky to grow no new hand. He walked over real close, bein' drunk, an' shot him through the liver.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: But if the other fellow is quicker and fires first...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: He will be hurryin' and he will miss. That there is as fast as I can pull an' aim an' hit anythin' more'n ten feet away... unless it's a barn.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: But... if he doesn't miss?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Then he will kill you. That is why there are so few dangerous men like old Bob there... an' like me. It ain't so easy to shoot a man anyhow... an' if the sonofabitch is shootin' back at you... well, it'll unnerve most fellas.  Look here, let me show you somethin'.  See this here pistol?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Them's the keys. All you gotta do is shoot me an' you an' English Bob can ride out free as birds.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Is... is it... loaded?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Wouldn't be no good if it wasn't. You got to cock it though.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: R-r-r-really? You r-r-really w- wwant...?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Give it to him.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: "Well, Jim," I says, "it makes me sick to see a man struttin' around and packin' two pistols an' a Henry rifle and cryin' like a baby."

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Did you... kill him?

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: No,... but I can't abide them kind... an' you will find a lot of them in the saloons... tramps an' drunk teamsters an' crazy miners... sportin' pistols like they was bad men, but not having no sand nor character... not even bad character.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: I do not like assassins an' men of low character like your friend English Bob... but Bob ain't no coward who will cry to your face an' then...

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Uh... Sheriff... Uh...

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: Huh? Oh.  Another one, huh? Shit, I guess I'm clean out of receptacles.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Maybe you should... hang the carpenter.

turns.speaker: LITTLE BILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Uh... hang the... uh... carpenter. I...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I was watchin' you... seein' if you was followed.

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: Silky an' Faith, they rode off to the East an' two deputies was followin' them.

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: Ned's share?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah, he went South ahead of us. I guess we'll catch him before...

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: He's... he's dead.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: No he ain't. He went South yesterday.

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: They... they killed him. I... thought you know that. I thought you knew because...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Nobody didn't kill Ned, he went South yesterday. He didn't even kill nobody. Why would anybody kill Ned?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Who killed him?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: Little Bill. The... the Bar T boys caught him and Little Bill...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He hanged him?  Shot him down?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: N-no. He... he beat him up. He was making him... answer questions... and beating him up... and then... Ned just died.  Little Bill didn't mean to kill him... he said he was sorry an' all... but he said it was a good example anyhow.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Good example! Good example of what I'd like to know? He didn't even kill nobody... he couldn't do it no more.

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: They got... a sign on him says he was a killer.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: A sign on him?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: In front of Greely's. It says, "This here is what happens to..."

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: They got a sign on him in front of Greely's?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: The questions Little Bill asked him... what sort of questions was they?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: About where you an' him  was... an' where you was from... an' what your names was... an'...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: What'd Ned say?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: L-lies... at first. About how you was just passin' through and didn't kill nobody... an' Little Bill kept askin' questions, mixin' him up, catchin' lies... an' then he'd beat on Ned an' Ned would cry and lie some more an' then... then...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Then... what?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: A cowboy come in sayin' you killed Quick Mike in the shit house at the Bar T...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: An' Little Bill killed Ned for what I done?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: Not on purpose. But he started hurtin' him worse... makin' him tell stuff. First ned wouldn't say nothin'... but Little Bill hurt him so bad he said who you was...

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: He said how you was really Three Fingered Jack out of Missouri... an' Bill said "Same Three Fingered Jack that dynamited the Rock Island and Pacific in '69 killin' women and children an' all?" An' Ned says you done a lot worse than that, said you was more cold blooded than William Bonney or Clay Alisson or the James Brothers an' how if he hurt Ned again you was gonna come an' kill him like you killed a U.S. Marshall in '73.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Didn't scare Little Bill though, did it?

turns.speaker: LITTLE SUE
turns.text: N-no, sir?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Lemmee see that Schofield, Kid.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: William Munny, yeah.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Same one as shot Charlie Pepper in Lake County?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You shot Charlie Pepper, didn't you? And you're the one killed William Harbey an' robbed the train over...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Hold on, mister.  Son, this here pig gotta be moved outta this pen, away from them others. Penny, you give yer brother a hand...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You're Pete Sothow's nephew, huh? Hell, I thought maybe you was someone come to kill me...  ...for somethin' I done in the old days.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I could of... easy.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Like I was sayin' you don't look like no meaner than hell cold-blooded damn killer.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Maybe I ain't.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, Uncle Pete said you was the goddamndest meanest sonofabitch ever lived an' if I ever wanted a partner for a killin', you was the worst one. Meanin' the best. On account of you're cold as snow an' don't have no weak nerve nor fear.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He said that, huh?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I'm a damn killer myself, only I ain't killed so many as you because of my youth. Schofield Kid, they call me.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Schofield? You from Schofield?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: On account of my Schofield model Smith and Wesson pistol.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, how about it?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Bein' my partner. I'm headin' North up around the Niobrara in Nebraska. Gonna kill a couple of no good cowboys.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: For cuttin' up a lady. They cut up her face an' cut her eyes out, cut her ears off an' her tits too.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Thousand dollars of reward. Five hundred a piece.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I ain't like that no more, Kid. Whiskey done it as much as anythin' I guess.  I ain't touched a drop in ten years. My wife, she cured me of it... cured me of drink an' wickedness.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well... you don't look so prosperous. Hell, you could buy her a new dress out of your half. We could kill them two an' you could buy your wife one of them fancy...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: She's passed on, Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Been gone near three years now.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Don't tell nobody about the reward an' all. Don't need no other gunmen tryin' to collect.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I don't never see nobody anyhow.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: If you was to change your mind, might be you could catch me... due West to the Western Trail an' North to Ogallala.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, we was. Like you said, I changed my mind an'...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Wasn't nothin' said about no partner.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, now Kid, there's two of these cowboys, ain't that so? Better there's three of us... maybe them cowboys got friends. Maybe...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I was gonna kill them two by myself. It don't take three.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Three ways, I figured.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Sorry, Ned. Guess I wasted your time. See ya, Kid!

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You're goin' back with him?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He's my partner. He don't go, I don't.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What the hell are you pissin' about, I'd like to know?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, what were you lookin' at anyhow?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Lookin' at?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Now hold on, boys, hold on. Now, Kid, you kin see fifty yards, can't you?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Bet your ass I kin see fifty yards an' I kin shoot this sonofabitch...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Easy, Kid, easy.  Now, you hear that, Ned? The Kid can see fifty yards fine, hear?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Say, Bill. That business in Jackson County... did that really happen? I mean how they say it happened?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: What business?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: An' how there was two deputies up close pointin' rifles at you... had you dead to rights... an' how you pulled out a pistol an' blew them both away to hell... an' only took a scratch yourself.  Uncle Pete told me he never seen nothin' like it, shootin' your way out of a scrape like that.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well... I don't recollect.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You don't recollect!

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Get some sleep, Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You boys are crotchety as a couple of hens.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Finish him, Ned.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He ain't dead? You didn't get him?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He got the boy's horse.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Did you kill him?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He's clear of the horse, Ned. Better get him.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What happened? He ain't dead? What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: If he gets behind them rocks we ain't gonna get him... not without we go down there.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What rocks? Why don't you shoot? What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What happened, did you hit him?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Better re-load it.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You missed him? You didn't...?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I got him.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He ain't killed.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Maybe, maybe not. Got him in the gut, I think.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: They takin' water?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: When we gonna double back?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: After a ways.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You're gonna lose your share. If you don't...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Shut up, Kid.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: It's gonna get riper yet.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You still think he's in there?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah, he's in there.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, he's holding on to his shit like it was money.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He's in there.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Tell me right off if you see him.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You... you ain't gonna shoot him yourownself?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You can shoot him.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Is it him?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Did... you... get... him?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Cover me, Kid, while I mount.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I can't see 'em.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Just SHOOT!

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Shit... I thought they was gonna get us. I was even... scared a little... just for a minute.  Was you ever scared in them days?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Say, Bill...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: That was... the first one.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: First one what?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: First one I ever killed.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: How I said I shot five men... it wasn't true.  That Mexican... the one that come at me with a knife... I busted his leg with a shovel... I didn't shoot him or nothin'.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, that fella today, you shot him alright.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: H-hell yeah. I killed the hell out of him... three shots... he was takin' a sh-sh-shit an'... an'...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Take a drink, Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Oh Ch-ch-christ... it don't... it don't seem... real... How he's... DEAD... how he ain't gonna breathe no more... n-n-never. Or the other one neither... On account of... of just... pullin' a trigger.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: It's a hell of a thing, ain't it, killin' a man. You take everythin' he's got... an' everythin' he's ever gonna have...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, I gu-guess they had it... comin'.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: We all got it comin', Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I trust you, Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, you don't wanna trust me too much. We'll take Ned his share together so you don't figure I run off with it.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Wha... what f-for?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Lemmee see it.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Sure. Sure, Bill.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You... gonna take... the money?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You better get on back, Miss.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You could have it. All of it.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I thought you wanted to buy spectacles an' fancy clothes an' all.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I'd rather be blind and ragged than dead, I guess.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: This here money, take my share an' Ned's an' leave it with my youngsters. Tell 'em half goes to Sally Two Trees if I ain't back in a week. The rest is yours... you could buy them spectacles.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Are you... Are you gonna... kill Little Bill?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I guess you won't mind my keepin' the bottle.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You're gonna kill him, ain't you?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Stay clear of folks you might see. There's plenty out lookin' to hang you. Go on now, skedaddle.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: I... I... think I'm... shot.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You ain't shot.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: P-p-p-please, I'm not armed.  M-m-my G-god. You killed... Little Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You sure you ain't armed?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: I never c-c-carry arms. I'm... a writer.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: A writer? What do you write... letters an' such?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: B-b-books.  You... you killed five men... singlehanded.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Wh-wh-who did you kill first?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Wh-wh-when confronted by superior numbers, the experienced gunfighter will fire on the best shots first.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I was lucky in the order.  I always been lucky killin' folks.

turns.speaker: WW
turns.text: Who was next? Clyde? Or was it...?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I could tell you who was last, mister.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: We ain't bad men no more, Bill. Hell, we're farmers.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Should be easy killin' em... supposin' they don't run off to Texas first.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: How long since you shot a gun at a man?  Nine... ten years?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Eleven.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Easy, huh? Hell, I don't know that it was all that easy then... an' we was young an' full of beans.  Bill... if you was mad at 'em... if they done you wrong... I could see shootin' 'em...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: We done stuff before for money, Ned.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, we thought we was doin' it for money...  What'd they do anyhow? Cheat at cards, steal some strays, spit on a rich fella?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Cut up a woman. Cut her eyes out, cut her tits off, cut her fingers off... done everythin' but cut up her cunny, I guess.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, I guess they got it comin'...  But you wouldn't go if Claudia was alive.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: How long you gonna be, Bill?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Two weeks, I guess.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: This Kid, what's he like?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Three ways?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yup. You still got the Spencer rifle?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Yeah, an' I could still hit a bird in the eye flyin'.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He musta been movin' right along.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: We'll come across him tomorra, I guess.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Got used to my bed. Ain't gonna feel to home out here.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, it ain't just the bed I'm gonna miss. I'm...  Hell, Billy, I'm sorry. I didn't mean...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: It ain't nothin', don't fret it.  She don't like it much, you goin' off with me.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Sally?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: She gave me the evil eye.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: It's just... she's a Indian an' Indians ain't... overfriendly.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I ain't blamin' her, Ned, I ain't holdin' it against her.  She knew me back then... an' she seen what a no good sonofabitch I was... an' she won't allow how I've changed. She just don't know how I ain't like that no more.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, she...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I ain't the same, Ned. Claudia, she... straightened me up, got me clear of the whiskey an' all. Us goin' to do this killin'... that don't mean I'm back to like I was. I just need the money... for a new start... for them youngsters.  Remember that drover, the one I shot in the mouth so's the teeth come out the back of his head? I dream about him now an' again. I didn't have no reason to shoot him... not one I could remember when I sobered up.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You was a... a crazy sonofabitch.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Nobody liked me... none of the boys. They was scared of me... figured I might shoot 'em out of pure meanness.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You ain't like that no more.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Eagle... he hated my guts. Bonaparte didn't like me none.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Nor Quincy, I guess.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Quincy, he was always watchin' me. Scared.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You ain't like that no more.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Hell, no. I'm just a fella now. Ain't no different from anyone else no more.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Say, Bill... You ever... ever go into town... an' all?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Sure, I got to. Got to get supplies.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: No. I mean...  ...an' get yourself a woman? You know?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Naw. Naw, I don't ever go into town for that.  A man like me... A man like me can't get no woman but one he's gonna pay for... an' that ain't right... buyin' flesh.  Claudia, God rest her soul, she wouldn't have wanted me doin' nothin' like that, me bein' a father, an' all.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Whaddaya do, just use your hand?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Sometimes... yeah.  I don't miss it all that much.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Some fucker's shootin' at us.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He hit you?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Naw. I bumped my head fallin' off of my horse.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He ain't shootin' our way no more.  He's shootin' over that way. Who's he shootin' at over that way?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Beats the hell out of me.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You suppose maybe we're in somebody's field?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I didn't see nothin' planted.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: HEY.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You're marking us, Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: HEY, KID.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Kid? The Kid's shootin at us?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: IS THAT YOU, KID?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Why would the Kid shoot at us?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: HEY KID, IT'S ME, BILL MUNNY.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Now Ned's a hell of a shot with a rifle. Hell, he can hit a bird in the eye flyin'.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Better'n you anyhow, Kid. You wasn't comin' close.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: How far kin you see?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Fifty yards ain't bad.  Guess we better get along.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I give it up 'cause I hate sleepin' out in the air... fuckin' sticks in my food... an' fuckin' bugs in my food... an' fuckin' rocks under my back...  Shit, I sure do miss my fuckin' bed.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah... you said that last night.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Last night I said I missed my fuckin' wife... tonight I just miss my fuckin' bed.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I brung this for when we had to kill them fellows.  I guess we could use some now.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Not for me. I don't touch it no more.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: God damn it, Bill, it's rainin'.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I know it's rainin',  Give the Kid a drink, why dontcha?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: What he was talkin' about... how them deputies had the drop on you an' Pete...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I remember how there was three of them deputies you shot... not two.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, I ain't like that no more, Ned. I ain't no crazy, killin' fool.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You still think it'll be easy shootin' them cowboys?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: You... you remember Eagle Hendershot?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Huh? Uh... yeah.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I seen him.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He's dead, Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: His head was all busted open so's you could see the inside.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Jesus, Bill, you got fever. Take a drink, will you?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Worms was comin' out.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Listen, Bill, I'm gonna see what's takin' The Kid so long. Must be he's gettin' an advance offa them sportin' ladies.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Claudia... ain't here, Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Ned... Is that you, Ned?  Ned, I seen... death.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Easy, Bill.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I seen the angel of death Ned, an' I seen the river.  He's a snake, he got... snake eyes.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Who, Bill? Who got snake eyes?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: The angel... the angel of death. I'm scared, Ned. Ned, I'm gonna die.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Easy, Bill, easy.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I seen her... I seen Claudia too...

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, that's good now, ain't it, Bill? Seein' Claudia an...?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: She was all covered with worms. Oh, Ned, I'm scared of dyin'...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: HOW MANY LEFT GODDAMIT?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I'm goin' on down to Kansas.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: We got to kill this other one first.  Shit, Ned, if we're lucky, we could kill him by nightfall... or maybe tomorrow morning. Then we could head back, all three of us, with the money.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You want the Spencer, Bill?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Shit, Ned, this ain't the time to quit.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Me an' the Kid, we'll head over to the ranch an' as soon as we find him, we'll shoot him. Then we'll come back an' the three of us pick up the money an' head South together.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Supposin' he don't go to the ranch?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I'll bet anything he won't go to town nor he won't ride out on the range. Right off he'll hole up at the ranch.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I ain't waitin', Bill.  I'll look in on your youngsters when I get back.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Ned, don't pay no mind to what the Kid said about the money. I'll bring your share along, hear? The Kid's full of shit, hear?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: What is it, son?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Two more hogs got the fever.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who's he?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Best we move that pig.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Hullo, paw.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: I guess you lost some hogs to the fever.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Three? That ain't bad considerin'.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That fella come by... Tom.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Tom?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The one you rode out after... the one that had the pistol...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: The Kid, yeah...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Only he wasn't carryin' no pistol this time.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: He say anythin'... The Kid... ?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Tom? Only how... how if you didn't... didn't come back in a week...  how we was to take half the money to Sally an' say you was...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Well, I come back, didn't I?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Did you... did you... ?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Did I what?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: All that money... I mean... did you...?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Steal it? Naw, I didn't steal it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No... I meant...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: K-k-kill somebody?

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Who said that?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: N-nobody... only you took your shotgun an' that pistol an'...

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Before I met your maw, God rest her soul, it used to be I was kinda... wicked... drinkin' spirits an' gettin' into scrapes an' all. Only she made me see the error of my ways an'... I ain't like I was no more.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I guess you didn't kill nobody then.

turns.speaker: MUNNY
turns.text: Naw, son, I didn't kill nobody.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: What was you shootin' at us for, anyhow?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Thought you was followin' me.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, this here's Ned Logan... Ned, this here's the Schofield Kid, nephew of Pete Sothow an'...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I seen two fellas followin' me, I guessed they come to kill me.  We didn't talk about no other fella.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I was only checkin' it for you. Thought maybe somethin' was bent.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Nothin's bent.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Well, you was shootin' every which way an'...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You gonna share your half with him?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Clouds, Kid. We was lookin' at them clouds on account of we got a storm ridin' up our ass.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Oh, them.  Hell, I seen them.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You was right to change your mind, Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I'm a damn good shot.  See that hawk up there? I could kill that hawk with one shot.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Far enough.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: We ain't goin' to Nebraska on no turtle hunt. A hundred yards?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: More.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: See that scrub oak yonder?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He's blind, for Chri...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I ain't blind, you asshole.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Say, Ned... ?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: How many men you killed?  Ain't you gonna answer?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I don't like the question.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, I gotta know what kind of fellas I'm ridin' with, don't I? In case of a scrape.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: How many you killed, Kid?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Five. I killed five of 'em.  That counts a Mexican I killed.  He come at me with a knife.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Jesus.  You done this before?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Plenty of times.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: His pistol must of jammed.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Move the candle closer, I can't see.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He wouldn't of took no beating like that if it hadn't of jammed. He wouldn't just give it over an' not shoot no one.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He didn't even pull his pistol, huh?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: He ain't as tough as you, Kid.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, I guess I woulda at least pulled my pistol an...

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Shit, Kid, you pulled your pistol... right outta the lady an' out the back window.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: That was your idea, I wanted to...

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: We're gonna need more food... at least three days worth...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Three days? We could kill 'em tomorrow.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I don't kill nobody without him.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: We don't need him. The two of us could do it.
